alert.note: Alert for Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 5:38PM CDT until August 29 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Benton, Carroll and Washington AR. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 538 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fayetteville... Springdale... Rogers... Bentonville... Eureka Springs... Bella Vista... Lowell... Farmington... Pea Ridge... Tontitown... Cave Springs... Greenland... Highfill... Gateway... Beaver... War Eagle... Northwest Arkansas Regional Airport...Drake Field Airport... Centerton... Johnson... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
